title: Dow Jones Top Company Headlines at 11 PM ET Intel's CEO, Under Attack From Trump, Is Already at Odds With His Board | Apple ...
region: No
sentence: Intel's CEO, Under Attack From Trump, Is Already at Odds With His Board Lip-Bu Tan and the chip maker's directors have been clashing over how to revive the tech giant. ---- Apple Got the Jump on Tariffs, Deciding Years Ago to Make iPhones in India Chief executive Tim Cook sought new factory locales outside China, a prescient move that along with a new $100 billion U.S. investment will shield the company-for now. ---- Meet TBD Lab, Meta's Superintelligence SWAT Team The new group is spearheading work on the latest version of Llama, the large language model that is Meta's answer to ChatGPT. ---- Australia's Iress in Takeover Talks With Private-Equity Firm Blackstone Australian financial-technology provider Iress said it is in talks with Blackstone, having already considered an earlier proposal by the U.S. private-equity giant ---- Expedia Lifts Full-Year Guidance After Revenue, Gross Bookings Rise The online travel agency raised its guidance for the full year after its second-quarter results beat expectations. ---- Pinterest Posts Higher Second-Quarter Profit On Growth in Gen Z Users The social media company reported net income of $38.8 million, or 6 cents a share. ---- Take-Two Interactive Software Raises Fiscal-Year Outlook on Improved First-Quarter Results The videogame developer now expects a narrower per-share loss of $2.40 to $2.05 for fiscal 2026. ---- Gilead Sciences Raises Guidance After Results Top Views The Foster City, Calif.-based biopharmaceutical company said the growth was driven by Biktarvy, Descovy, Trodelvy and Livdelzi. ---- OpenAI Unveils GPT-5, Its Latest and Most Powerful Model, After Two-Year Wait CEO Sam Altman said using the chatbot will be like talking with a doctorate-level expert in any topic. ---- Block Raises 2025 Outlook as Gross Profit Improves The company behind payment systems Cash App and Square sees full-year gross profit, a key indicator for Block, increasing 14.4%, up from previous guidance of 12% growth. ---- Motorola Solutions Posts Higher Profit, Revenue The safety and security company posted higher profit and revenue in the second quarter, saying it is continuing to work with its global supply base to mitigate exposure to tariff risks. ---- Flutter Entertainment Posts Higher Second-Quarter Revenue Amid FanDuel Purchase The betting company posted $4.19 billion in revenue, beating analyst expectations. ---- Disney Settles Suit With Actress Dismissed From 'The Mandalorian' With financial backing from Elon Musk's X, Gina Carano alleged she was fired from the Star Wars series over social media posts. ---- Summer Concert Season Off to a Booming Start, Live Nation Says Strong attendance and fan spending helped the world's largest concert promoter beat expectations for its second-quarter revenue, but its earnings per share fell short. ---- Instacart Nearly Doubles Second-Quarter Profit on Increased Orders The grocery-delivery company, also known as Maplebear, posted net income of $116 million, or 41 cents a share. ---- Wynn Resorts Logs Lower Profit The Las Vegas operator of casinos and resorts reported that sales rose slightly, with casino revenue offsetting declines across the rest of the company's segments. ---- SoundHound Raises Revenue View as More Businesses embrace Automation Companies used to be wary of replacing their customer service with AI.
